description: From Latin puerīlis (“childish”), from puer (“child, boy”).

adjectives.description: puerile (comparative more puerile, superlative most puerile)

examples: Synonyms: juvenile, silly, trifling; see also Thesaurus:childish, Thesaurus:insignificant

entries.meaning: Characteristic of, or pertaining to, a boy or boys; compare puellile.
